title_sort: thomas jefferson whitman to louisa van velsor whitman, 18 march 1870
title: Thomas Jefferson Whitman to Louisa Van Velsor Whitman, 18 March 1870
text: St. Louis,Mar 18th 1870My Dear MotherMattie arrived all right on Wednesday abt[about] 3ocl—in the afternoon—We were all glad enough to see her I assur[assure] you—The weather had been very bad ever since she left Brooklyn—but she got along very comfortably—and looked very well when she got in—I should have written you yesterday—but I understoo[d] Mat to say that she either would or had done soMat had a fine visit home and I think it has done her lots of good—also I am very glad to hear that there is a prospect of getting you and Walt out here—hope you will come sure—Please excuse this letter as I have just time to say that Mat arrived safely—the children are well and happy as can be—affectionately Jeff Thomas Jefferson Whitman to Louisa Van Velsor Whitman, 18 March 1870
